apiKey.label: API key
apiKey.intro: API keys can be used to authorize external applications to programmatically access, create, and update content on behalf of your organization. Each key is unique to your organization and provides a secure way to integrate with external services and automate content management workflows.
apiKey.keyNameTooltip: A descriptive name for the API key, for instance referencing the archive or application that will use it.
apiKey.expiresTooltip: The number of days after which the API key should expire. Keep it empty if the API key should never expire.
apiKey.copyKeyWarning: Please store your key securely, it will only be shown once.
apiKey.deleteConfirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the API key '$1'?

organization.label: Organization
organization.name: Name
organization.logoTooltip: The logo will be displayed in the header of the application.
organization.deleteConfirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the organization '$1'?

statusMessage.label: Status message
statusMessage.intro: Status messages are used to inform users about service status, updates, or important announcements related to your organization. They can be used to communicate planned maintenance, service disruptions, or other relevant information that users should be aware of when interacting with your organization.
statusMessage.title: Title
statusMessage.deleteConfirmationMessage: Are you sure you want to delete the status message '$1'?
